newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta call money traded at 12.0/12.5 percent.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta call money traded at 12.0/12.5 percent.

text.p: Jakarta call money was traded at 12.0/12.5 percent on Wednesday morning, dealers said.
They said liquidity was sufficient, with the central bank offer of short-term bilateral papers (SBIs) at 12.0 percent limiting overnight rates from further softening.
The central bank supplied 546 billion rupiah on Wednesday.
"There is not much activity in the market. Liquidity appears to be sufficient," one local bank dealer said.
The bank continued to keep short-term rates high to reduce speculative dollar buying using cheap rupiah.

The bank offered one-to-two day SBIs at 12.0 percent, five-to-six day at 12.0 percent, seven at 7.5 percent, two-week at 8.5 percent, one-month at 10.5, three at 11.0, six at 11.625 and one-year at 12.25 percent.
The average overnight interbank rate on Tuesday was 13.97 percent, compared with 13.46 percent on Monday.
